name: Kachumber Salad
history: Kachumber Salad is a traditional Indian salad known for its simplicity and freshness. It typically includes chopped vegetables like cucumbers, tomatoes, and onions, seasoned with spices, and sometimes accompanied by lemon juice or vinegar.
description: Kachumber Salad is a refreshing and crunchy salad made with a mix of diced cucumbers, tomatoes, onions, and green chilies. It's seasoned with salt, pepper, and often a dash of lemon juice, making it a perfect accompaniment to Indian meals.

instructions.title: Mix Vegetables
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine the chopped cucumbers, tomatoes, onions, and green chilies.

instructions.title: Season the Salad
instructions.description: Add the chopped coriander leaves, lemon juice, salt, and freshly ground black pepper to the bowl. Toss the ingredients well to ensure an even mix.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Kachumber Salad immediately, or refrigerate for a short time before serving to enhance the flavors.

tips: Use fresh and crisp vegetables for the best taste.
Adjust the amount of green chilies and lemon juice according to your preference.
variations: Add grated carrots or beetroot for additional color and nutrition.
Sprinkle with chaat masala or cumin powder for an extra flavor kick.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh. Can be refrigerated for up to 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

presentationTips: Serve in a decorative salad bowl, garnished with extra coriander leaves.
Accompany with a slice of lemon or lime on the side.
